body: LEAD: At the crowded produce markets and clothing shops on Coney Island Avenue yesterday, the day before Yom Kippur, the preparations for the most solemn holiday on the Jewish calendar were almost complete. title: The Talk of Midwood; A Scar Now Where Torahs Burned

title: Computer Analyst Marries Batya Spirn, Editorial Aide

body: LEAD: The Army Corps of Engineers is exploring a plan to use underwater pits near the shores of Brooklyn, Queens, Staten Island and Monmouth County, N.J., to bury dredged material that does not meet Federal ocean dumping standards, and the plan has created a furor. title: Furor Over Bay Burial of Dredged Material

body: LEAD: Six weeks now. Six weeks now. Forty-two days when the sun and seas and sins of man have conspired to transform New York life into a seemingly endless slog through simmering broth. And yesterday, after six weeks of sweltering weather, people were talking less about the possibility of a break in the heat than how the coming of the Northeastern
title: The Great Flood of Heat: 42 Days And 42 Nights, and Life Is Altered

body: LEAD: The weekend was saved for beachgoers in Brooklyn yesterday as New York City park officials reopened Coney Island and Brighton beaches. But eight beaches on Staten Island and in Suffolk, Nassau and Westchester Counties remained closed because of medical waste or high bacteria counts. The weekend was saved for beachgoers in Brooklyn yesterday
title: Park Officials Reopen 2 Brooklyn Beaches

body: LEAD: All the municipal beaches on Staten Island and in Brooklyn were closed yesterday when sewage gushed into New York Harbor after a power failure at a sewage-treatment plant, adding new concerns for beachgoers and health officials already alarmed by recent deposits of medical waste on the local shoreline. All the municipal beaches on Staten
title: Beaches on Brooklyn and S.I. Close as Sewage Hits Harbor

body: LEAD: FIFTEEN years ago, Midwood was headed downhill. Stores were closing, houses were up for sale and apartments were beginning to crumble. title: Performing Arts On College Stages: High Quality At Low Prices
